channel.title: CPR (re)Certification – North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies
channel.description: Better nannying for North Carolina starts here!

image.title: CPR (re)Certification – North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies

item.title: [triangle] FREE CPR Skills Refresher
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: In Durham, on Wednesday, August 17th, there will be a free skills refresher for CPR. It does not include certification.
item.content:encoded:
In Durham, on Wednesday, August 17th at 10 am, there will be a free skills refresher for CPR. It does not include certification.

This is a great opportunity to refresh your own CPR skills or to send to employers who may not be interested in becoming fully certified but want some hands on practice. Attendees will need to wear face masks as a disease prevention protocol.

Includes Infant CPR.

more details on facebook

item.title: (triangle) CPR (re)Certification Class
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Levenbook
item.description: The following is a signal boost for those who may be interested in attending this CPR class. It is being offered for nannies by Nanny919, an area nanny consultancy. The link to the original post can be found [HERE].
item.content:encoded:
The following is a signal boost for those who may be interested in attending this CPR class. It is being offered for nannies by Nanny919, an area nanny consultancy.

item.title: Follow Up:Â First Aid + CPR (re)Certification including AED 2018
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: We learned a lot at the 2018 First Aid + CPR (re)Certification including AED course offered by the North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies. Many thanks are owed to our volunteer instructor and to the NC PAN member who generously provided the space. If you are due for a recertification in 2019, please continue to […]
item.content:encoded:
We learned a lot at the 2018 First Aid + CPR (re)Certification including AED course offered by the North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies. Many thanks are owed to our volunteer instructor and to the NC PAN member who generously provided the space.

If you are due for a recertification in 2019, please continue to watch this space! We will be offering a course, bi-annually. All attempts will be made to have the course near interNational Nanny Training Day, as this one was.

We would like to invite you to share your photos from the event. Please email them to webmaster@ncpan.org.

item.title: First Aid + CPR (re)Certification including AED for 2018
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Please join the North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies for our annual First Aid + CPR (re)Certification course. Whether it is your first time becoming First Aid or CPR certified or you need a renewal, we are here to help. This course covers infant, child, and adult CPR, AED, as well as infant, child, and […]
item.content:encoded:
Please join the North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies for our annual First Aid + CPR (re)Certification course. Whether it is your first time becoming First Aid or CPR certified or you need a renewal, we are here to help. This course covers infant, child, and adult CPR, AED, as well as infant, child, and adult First Aid. You will receive your two year professional rescuer certification from the American Red Cross on successful completion. This is a higher level certification than is issued at general community courses and is aimed for those who will be using CPR and First Aid as part of their job.

Cost: $38.

The American Red Cross is transitioning all of their trainings to a blended online-study/in-person-assessment system to cut down on actual class time. Take the online video modules (4 hours worth) at your own pace and on your own schedule, and then we will gather for a review session with our instructor, who will then give us a practical exam and provide us with our certifications.

The CPR (re)Certification Practical will take place on the 11th of March, starting at 1 pm at the Triangle home of one of our member nannies. It will last at most 3.5 hours.

For those of us who need the classroom environment, we are offering time to do the video modules at the same location, on the same day, starting at 8 am. Please bring earbuds/headphones and an internet-capable device (smart phone, tablet, laptop, etc.) with you. Internet access will be provided.

This event is being offered at cost, meaning that the fee covers only the cost required by the American Red Cross to issue your certification and card. Payment must be made directly to the American Red Cross using the link sent in your registration confirmation email.Â The instructor is volunteering her time. We will ask you to sign a thank you card for her efforts.

NC PAN Members will have priority for the seats in the First Aid + CPR (re)Certification, so know that if you are a non-member, you may be moved to the waiting list if this training proves popular.**

This certification is good for 2 YEARS and INCLUDES FIRST AID.

Attendance is limited. Register in advance.

[products ids=”10464,10465″ orderby=”id”]

There is no requirement to purchase a pocket resuscitator mask when you RSVP. You can simply borrow one for use that day.

** If you already are in possession of a pocket resuscitator mask that you personally own and can bring with you, we have TWO (2) slots available regardless of NC PAN membership. Those spots are GUARANTEED. There is zero chance of you being moved to a waiting list.Â Email cpr@ncpan.org to take advantage of this. Failure to bring your mask will result in being turned away.

item.title: Follow Up:Â First Aid + CPR (re)Certification including AED 2017
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: We learned a lot at the 2017 First Aid + CPR (re)Certification including AED course offered by the North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies. Many thanks are owed to our volunteer instructor and to Triangle’s Best Karate who generously provided the space. If you are due for a recertification in 2018, please continue to watch […]
item.content:encoded:
We learned a lot at the 2017 First Aid + CPR (re)Certification including AED course offered by the North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies. Many thanks are owed to our volunteer instructor and to Triangle’s Best Karate who generously provided the space.

If you are due for a recertification in 2018, please continue to watch this space! We will be offering a course, bi-annually. All attempts will be made to have the course near interNational Nanny Training Day, as this one was.

We would like to invite you to share your photos from the event. Please email them to webmaster@ncpan.org.

item.title: UPDATE First Aid + CPR (re)Certification including AED
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Please join the North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies for our biannual First Aid + CPR (re)Certification course. Whether it is your first time becoming First Aid or CPR certified or you need a renewal, we are here to help. This course covers infant, child, and adult CPR, AED, as well as infant, child, and […]
item.content:encoded:
Please join the North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies for our biannual First Aid + CPR (re)Certification course. Whether it is your first time becoming First Aid or CPR certified or you need a renewal, we are here to help. This course covers infant, child, and adult CPR, AED, as well as infant, child, and adult First Aid. You will receive your two year certification from the American Red Cross on successful completion.

This CPR (re)Certification Course will take place on the 30th of April, starting atÂ 10:30Â am at Triangle’s Best Karate in Raleigh, NC. It is being offered as part ofÂ National Nanny Training DayÂ education.

We had to change the start time over previously advertised start time and as a result will be having a working lunch. Thank you for your flexibility.

In the interest of providing this class in the shortest time possible, we ask that you pack your lunch to be eaten during instruction. There is a nearby grocery store and pizza can be delivered to the event location, for those not wishing to prepare in advance.

Attendance is limited. Register in advance.

This event is being offered at cost, meaning that the fee covers only the cost required by the American Red Cross to issue your certification and card. Payment can be made at the door by cash or check. Change will be available.

GOLD and PLATINUM package holders of National Nanny Training Day: Research Triangle Park are being given first access to the limited slots for this CPR course. Once they have been satisfied,Â NC PAN MembersÂ will then have priority for the seats in the First Aid + CPR (re)Certification, so know that if you are not attending National Nanny Training Day: Research Triangle Park and are a Â non-member, you may be moved to the waiting list if this training proves popular.**

MoneyÂ for this First Aid + CPR (re)Certification will go directly to the American Red Cross to exactly cover our costs for the cards and certification. The instructor is volunteering her time.

This certification is good for 2 YEARS and INCLUDES FIRST AID.

** If you already are in possession of a pocket resuscitator mask that you personally own and can bring with you, we have TWO (2) slots available regardless of #NNTDRTP participation or NC PAN membership. Email cpr@ncpan.org to register. Failure to bring your mask when registering at this level, will result in being turned away.

item.content:encoded:
Please join the North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies for our biannual First Aid + CPR (re)Certification course. Whether it is your first time becoming First Aid or CPR certified or you need a renewal, we are here to help. This course covers infant, child, and adult CPR, AED, as well as infant, child, and adult First Aid. You will receive your two year certification from the American Red Cross on successful completion.

This CPR (re)Certification Course will take place on the 30th of April, starting at 9Â am at Triangle’s Best Karate in Raleigh, NC. It is being offered as part ofÂ National Nanny Training DayÂ education.

In the interest of providing this class in the shortest time possible, we ask that you pack your lunch to be eaten during instruction. There is a nearby grocery store and pizza can be delivered to the event location, for those not wishing to prepare in advance.

We are not yet accepting individual sign-ups at this time. You can only* sign-up in conjunction with a packaged ticket for National Nanny Training Day: Research Triangle Park.

This event is being offered at cost, meaning that the fee covers only the cost required by the American Red Cross to issue your certification and card. Payment can be made at the door by cash or check. Change will be available.

Attendees of National Nanny Training Day: Research Triangle Park are being given first access* to the limited slots for this CPR course.

On April 1st, if any remain, tickets will be available to those who are only interested in this event.Â NC PAN MembersÂ will then have priority for the seats in the First Aid + CPR (re)Certification, so know that non-members may be moved to the waiting list if this training proves popular with our membership.

MoneyÂ for this First Aid + CPR (re)Certification will go directly to the American Red Cross to exactly cover our costs for the cards and certification. The instructor is volunteering her time.

This certification is good for 2 YEARS and INCLUDES FIRST AID.

* If you already are in possession of a pocket resuscitator mask that you personally own and can bring with you, we have TWO (2) slots available regardless of #NNTDRTP participation. Email cpr@ncpan.org to register. Failure to bring your mask when registering at this level, will result in being turned away.

Many thanks are owed to our volunteer instructor and to Triangle’s Best Karate who generously provided the space. [metaslider id=”49094″] If you are due for a recertification in 2016, please continue to […]
item.content:encoded:
We learned a lot at the 2015Â First Aid + CPR (re)Certification including AED course offered by the North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies. Many thanks are owed to our volunteer instructor and to Triangle’s Best Karate who generously provided the space.

[metaslider id=”49094″]

If you are due for a recertification in 2016, please continue to watch this space! We will be offering a course, annually. All attempts will be made to have the course during National Nanny Recognition Week, as this one was.

There are even more photos over at the event gallery on BigTent (members only). We would like to invite you to share your photos from the event. Please submit them on BigTent (members only), become a member so that you can submit them on BigTent, or email them to webmaster@ncpan.org.

item.title: First Aid + CPR (re)Certification including AED
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Please join the North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies for our biannual First Aid + CPR (re)Certification course. Whether it is your first time becoming First Aid or CPR certified or you need a renewal, we are here to help. This course covers infant, child, and adult CPR, AED, as well as infant, child, and […]
item.content:encoded:
Please join the North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies for our biannual First Aid + CPR (re)Certification course. Whether it is your first time becoming First Aid or CPR certified or you need a renewal, we are here to help. This course covers infant, child, and adult CPR, AED, as well as infant, child, and adult First Aid. You will receive your two year certification from the American Red Cross on successful completion.

This CPR (re)Certification Course will take place on the 20th of September, starting at 8 am at Triangle’s Best Karate in Raleigh, NC. It is being offered as part of the 2015 National Nanny Recognition Week celebrations.

In the interest of providing this class in the shortest time possible, we ask that you pack your lunch to be eaten during instruction.

Attendance is limited! Advanced tickets are required!
SIGN UP!
This event is being offered at cost, meaning that the fee covers only the cost required by the American Red Cross to issue your certification and card. Payment can be made at the door by cash or check. Change will be available.

NC PAN Members have priority for the seats in the First Aid + CPR (re)Certification, so know that non-members may be moved to the waiting list if this training proves popular with our membership.

The proceeds from this First Aid + CPR (re)Certification will go directly to the American Red Cross to exactly cover our costs for the cards and certification. The instructor is volunteering her time.

This certification is good for 2 YEARS and INCLUDES FIRST AID.
